episode.title: Under Rumored
episode.author: Daring Fireball / John Gruber
episode.description: Jim Dalrymple returns to the show for a preview of next week's Apple event. We speculate (wrongly, it seems to have turned out) on the naming of the new iPhones, facial recognition in lieu of Touch ID, third-generation Apple Watches, Apple TV, HomePod, and more.
episode.showNotes:
Jim Dalrymple returns to the show for a preview of next week's Apple event. We speculate on the naming of the new iPhones, facial recognition in lieu of Touch ID, third-generation Apple Watches, Apple TV, HomePod, and more.

Sponsored by:

  • Casper: An obsessively engineered mattress at a shockingly fair price. Use code thetalkshow for $50 toward your mattress.
  • Warby Parker: Boutique-quality, vintage-inspired glasses at a revolutionary price. Try up to five pairs at home for free.
  • Squarespace: Build it beautiful. Use code gruber for 10% off your first order.
  • Fracture: Your photos, printed directly on glass.

Links:

  • Steven Sinofsky on the WSJ's report of iPhone production delays: "Anyone who has ever made anything knows this is simply called manufacturing."
  • Hacking an iPhone 7 to add a headphone jack.
  • Apple bragging about Siri’s improved voice quality.
  • Steve Jobs's epic on-stage tirade about "570 Wi-Fi hotspots" interfering with his demos in 2010.

This episode of The Talk Show was edited by Caleb Sexton.
